body_html: @varunkumar3618 In my understanding, if you use queues as the input source, it's kind of "built in" to the computation graph. So I would like to use a tf.cond which read a boolean and determine which function to be used. Then, you can change the value of the boolean on the go.
body_text: @varunkumar3618 In my understanding, if you use queues as the input source, it's kind of "built in" to the computation graph. So I would like to use a tf.cond which read a boolean and determine which function to be used. Then, you can change the value of the boolean on the go.
body: @varunkumar3618 In my understanding, if you use queues as the input source, it's kind of "built in" to the computation graph. So I would like to use a `tf.cond` which read a boolean and determine which function to be used. Then, you can change the value of the boolean on the go.
